application_details.scheme_name:
Existing Modular Kitchen - Renewal of temporary planning permission
No actual work is proposed

description: APPLICATION FOR THE EXTENSION OF THE EXISTING PLANNING PERMISSION FOR A TEMPORARY KITCHEN.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: [15405(SK)00-03, 15405(SK)00-09, 15405(SK)00-07, 15405(SK)00-05, 15405(SK)00-01, Site Location Plan]

Condition : 3 - No Use of Flat Roof  - Access to the flat roof of the development hereby permitted shall be for maintenance or emergency purposes only, and the flat roof shall not be used as a roof garden, terrace, patio or similar amenity area.

Condition : 4 - The use hereby permitted shall only operate during school term times
between the hours of 08.00 to 16.00 Monday to Friday.

Condition : 5 - All deliveries, loading, unloading or other servicing activities shall
not take place between the hours of 08.00 - 09.00 and 15.00 to
16.30 Monday to Friday.

Condition : 6 - The outbuilding shall only be used as a kitchen for the school and for
no other purpose (classroom for example), (including any other
purpose within Class D1 of the Schedule to the Town and Country
Planning (Use Classes Order) 1987), or in any provision equivalent to
that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that
Order with or without modification.
Condition : 7 - Opening over Highway - The doors of the garage or gates hereby approved shall not open over the adjacent highway.

Condition : 8 - The proposed outbuilding (kitchen) and timber fence (attached to front boundary wall)
is for a temporary period of 3 years and the use hereby permitted shall cease and the
land restored to its former condition (notwithstanding the proposed front boundary
wall/gates) on or before (04/04/2028).
Condition : 9 - The doors of the garage or gates hereby approved shall not open over the adjacent highway.

Condition : 10 - The kitchen ventilation and extract system shall be installed in accordance with the approved plans and specifications before the use commences and shall be permanently retained as such thereafter. - Servicing of the system shall be undertaken as in line with the manufacturers specification.
Condition : 11 - Refuse bins must be stored within the curtilage of the premises and not left overnight in the street.

Condition : 12 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant -Approved Schemes
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to the delivery of sustainable development, by:
1. Providing a formal pre-application advice service, details to be found on Planning pre-application advice service on LBM's website
2. Providing written policies and guidance, which is available to view on LBM's website.
3. Where appropriate, negotiating amendments to secure a positive decision.
4. Determining applications in a timely manner including providing a fast track service, details to be found on Get a quicker planning decision on LBM's website.

In this instance:
i) The application was acceptable as submitted, and approved [without delay/ with an agreed determination date].

ii) The application was amended following negotiations with the Council to ensure the scheme complied with adopted policy and guidance, and a decision was made [without delay/ with an agreed determination date].

iii) The application was recommended for approval and referred to the first available Planning Committee, where the agents / applicants had an opportunity to present the application.

Condition : 13 - Noise levels, (expressed as the equivalent continuous sound level) LAeq (15 minutes), from the plant/machinery associated with the ductwork installation shall not exceed LA90-1 0dB at the boundary with the closest residential property. 

Reason:  To safeguard the amenities of surrounding area and to ensure compliance with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policies D4 and D14 of the London Plan 2021 and policies D12.1 & D12.3 of the Local Plan 2024.
